org.settings4j
Interface ContentResolver

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClasspathContentResolver, DBContentResolverAdapter, FSContentResolver, ReadOnlyContentResolverWrapper, UnionContentResolver
public interface ContentResolver

a ContentResolver is a Helper for read/write byte[] content for a given key. 

 
 Example configuration in settings4j.xml:
 --------------------------------------
 <contentResolver name="ClasspathContentResolver" class="org.settings4j.contentresolver.ClasspathContentResolver">
 </contentResolver>
 --------------------------------------

Author:
hbrabenetz

Method Summary
 void addContentResolver(ContentResolver contentResolver)
          Some Implementations of a ContentResolver are delegating the functionality to other ContentResolvers.
 byte[] getContent(java.lang.String key)
          Reads the Content for the given Key or null if nothing where found.
 int setContent(java.lang.String key, byte[] value)
          Set a new byte[] Content for the given Key.
 

Method Detail

getContent

byte[] getContent(java.lang.String key)
Reads the Content for the given Key or null if nothing where found.

Parameters:
key - The key
Returns:
The byte[] Content or null if nothing where found.

setContent

int setContent(java.lang.String key,
               byte[] value)
Set a new byte[] Content for the given Key. If the Implementation can write the Content, then the Connector must return Constants.SETTING_SUCCESS
If there was a Problem, or The Connector doesn't supports write-access, then the Connector must return Constants.SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE

Parameters:
key - The Key for the new content
value - The new byte[] Content for the given Key
Returns:
Constants.SETTING_SUCCESS or Constants.SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE

addContentResolver

void addContentResolver(ContentResolver contentResolver)
Some Implementations of a ContentResolver are delegating the functionality to other ContentResolvers.
Examples are: ReadOnlyContentResolverWrapper or UnionContentResolver 
 --------------------------------------
 <contentResolver name="DefaultContentResolver" class="org.settings4j.contentresolver.UnionContentResolver">
     <contentResolver-ref ref="FSContentResolver" />
     <contentResolver-ref ref="ClasspathContentResolver" />
 </contentResolver>
 --------------------------------------

Parameters:
contentResolver - the original contentResolver to delegate.
